pr_title: [PIP-54] Support acknowledgment at batch index level

timeline.message: Add support for batch local index ack

timeline.bodyText:
It seems that a large code section has been locked/unlocked. You might want to consider to move these initialization outside of protect section.
Isn't ConcurrentSkipListMap already thread safe when you read? Probably only the iteration should be protected. I think the goal is avoid lock a large section of code not to let another thread to wait on.
timeline.author: zzzming

timeline.bodyText: Ditto. I think only batchDeleteIndexes.get() part should be locked. Again, double check with concurrentSkipList get() if it is already a thread safe data struct in terms of read. I think it should although I have never used this map collection.
timeline.author: zzzming
zzzming
zzzming

timeline.bodyText: Double ;; You might want to do a global replacement since these are in multiple places.
timeline.author: zzzming

replies.bodyText: The PulsarApi.java is generated by a proto tool. So I won’t do it manually here, it's better to improve the generation tool.
replies.author: codelipenghui

timeline.bodyText: Would this case be covered if the total number of messages in a batch is greater the allowed number of permits? Or is this not even possible?
timeline.author: zzzming

replies.bodyText: The batch size can greater than available permits and already handled at the client size.
replies.author: codelipenghui

timeline.bodyText: If this is a feature has to enabled on the broker, is there a way for consumer to know or set such feature is supported? I think the problem comes how to help troubleshooting when both broker and consumer need to support this.
timeline.author: zzzming

replies.bodyText:
Should we consider adding a flag to enable or disable at consumer side? I think this feature does not introduce too much overhead on the consumer side.
For troubleshooting, users just to ensure that their brokers are enabled this feature and the client version is 2.6.0
replies.author: codelipenghui

timeline.author: sijie
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -608,4 +608,9 @@ void asyncFindNewestMatching(FindPositionConstraint constraint, Predicate<Entry>
      * Trim delete entries for the given entries
      */
     void trimDeletedEntries(List<Entry> entries);
+
+    /**
+     * Get deleted batch indexes list for a batch message.
+     */
+    long[] getDeletedBatchIndexesLongArray(PositionImpl position);

timeline.author: sijie
sijie
sijie

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need a concurrent bit set?
timeline.author: sijie

timeline.bodyText: bookkeeper has a pretty efficient AckSet / WriteSet implementation that can avoid producing a lot of garbages. I think we should leverage the implementation there - https://github.com/apache/bookkeeper/blob/master/bookkeeper-server/src/main/java/org/apache/bookkeeper/client/RoundRobinDistributionSchedule.java#L76
timeline.author: sijie

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as I made to client side change. We should consider re-using some of the AckSet implementation in bookkeeper client.
timeline.author: sijie

timeline.message: Introduce BitSetRecyclable that leverage with netty recycler
Add support for batch local index ack
Introduce BitSetRecyclable that leverage with netty recycler
